bots

Class Bot

  • java.lang.Object
    • bots.Bot
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Drone, HumanBot, RandBot, SentryBot

    public abstract class Bot
extends java.lang.Object
    Introduction

    This is an abstract class for a BattleBots player. All Bots to be used in the arena must extend this class, and must be part of the bots package.

    The Bots decide at each frame whether to move, shoot, and message one another, but they do not get to decide where they are, and they do not get to do any processing except when their methods are called by the BattleBotArena (i.e. no Timers or extra Threads allowed). Bots are also limited in the amount of processing they can do in the course of a match (see the rules on this in the BattleBotArena class).

    The arena is the referee and decides where the Bots are based on the moves they request. It also decides when they are allowed to make those moves, when they overheat, and when they die. The Bots do draw themselves, but are honour-bound to draw themselves at the location the Arena gives them when it calls their draw() method.

    Rules
    1. All code for a single Bot must be contained within a single class within a single file. No inner classes or anonymous inner classes are allowed either.
    2. Bots may not spawn threads or use timers or any other method to get around the CPU limits imposed by the arena.
    3. Bots should draw themselves (mostly) within a circle inscribed in a square of side length equal to RADIUS * 2.
    4. You may draw your Bots using images (see imageNames() and loadedImages() below) but these images should be resized to be squares of side length RADIUS * 2 so as not to take up too much memory (most of the available memory is needed for the instant replay system).
    5. Messages to other Bots will be truncated to 200 characters. For display purposes, they will be truncated to whatever fits on the screen.

    Rubric

    To get an A+, your robot should meet all of the following criteria:
    1. Your code must meet all the standards and rules set out in this documentation.
    2. Your code must be fully documented to javadoc standards.
    3. Your strategy must be completely described in the class header. It should be well thought out and ambitious.
    4. Your code must be commented in a way that makes it clear where and how the different parts of your strategy are implemented.
    5. Your strategy must make use of at least two of the three arrays of information provided by the Arena in each call to getMove().
    6. Your code must be as efficient as possible. There should be no superfluous or unnecessary comparison or assignment operations.

    More Information

    For a more complete set of rules, see the BattleBotArena class. For more info about this class, see the comments on each of its methods.

    • Field Detail

      • RADIUS

        public static final int RADIUS
        The radius of a Bot. Each Bot should fit into a circle inscribed into a square with height and width equal to RADIUS * 2.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        protected int botNumber
        This is your Bot's number, a unique identifier assigned at the beginning of each round.

    • Method Detail

      • newRound

        public abstract void newRound()
        This method is called at the beginning of each round. Use it to perform any initialization that you require when starting a new round.

      • getMove

        public abstract int getMove(BotInfo me,
                            boolean shotOK,
                            BotInfo[] liveBots,
                            BotInfo[] deadBots,
                            Bullet[] bullets)
        This method is called at every time step to find out what you want your Bot to do. The legal moves are defined in constants in the BattleBotArena class (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, FIREUP, FIREDOWN, FIRELEFT, FIRERIGHT, STAY, SEND_MESSAGE).

        The FIRE moves cause a bullet to be created (if there are not too many of your bullets on the screen at the moment). Each bullet moves at speed set by the BULLET_SPEED constant in BattleBotArena.

        The UP, DOWN, LEFT, and RIGHT moves cause the bot to move BOT_SPEED pixels in the requested direction (BOT_SPEED is a constant in BattleBotArena). However, if this would cause a collision with any live or dead bot, or would move the Bot outside the playing area defined by TOP_EDGE, BOTTOM_EDGE, LEFT_EDGE, and RIGHT_EDGE, the move will not be allowed by the Arena.

        The SEND_MESSAGE move (if allowed by the Arena) will cause a call-back to this Bot's outgoingMessage() method, which should return the message you want the Bot to broadcast. This will be followed with a call to incomingMessage(String) which will be the echo of the broadcast message coming back to the Bot.
        Parameters:
        me - A BotInfo object with all publicly available info about this Bot
        shotOK - True iff a FIRE move is currently allowed
        liveBots - An array of BotInfo objects for the other Bots currently in play
        deadBots - An array of BotInfo objects for the dead Bots littering the arena
        bullets - An array of all Bullet objects currently in play
        Returns:
        A legal move (use the constants defined in BattleBotArena)

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                          int x,
                          int y)
        Called when it is time to draw the Bot. Your Bot should be (mostly) within a circle inscribed inside a square with top left coordinates (x,y) and a size of RADIUS * 2. If you are using an image, just put null for the ImageObserver - the arena has some special features to make sure your images are loaded before you will use them.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to draw yourself on.
        x - The x location of the top left corner of the drawing area
        y - The y location of the top left corner of the drawing area

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        This method will only be called once, just after your Bot is created, to set your name permanently for the entire match.
        Returns:
        The Bot's name

      • getTeamName

        public abstract java.lang.String getTeamName()
        This method is called at every time step to find out what team you are currently on. Of course, there can only be one winner, but you can declare and change team allegiances throughout the match if you think anybody will care. Perhaps you can send coded broadcast message or invitation to other Bots to set up a temporary team...
        Returns:
        The Bot's current team name

      • outgoingMessage

        public abstract java.lang.String outgoingMessage()
        This is only called after you have requested a SEND_MESSAGE move (see the documentation for getMove()). However if you are already over your messaging cap, this method will not be called. Messages longer than 200 characters will be truncated by the arena before being broadcast, and messages will be further truncated to fit on the message area of the screen.
        Returns:
        The message you want to broadcast

      • incomingMessage

        public abstract void incomingMessage(int botNum,
                                     java.lang.String msg)
        This is called whenever the referee or a Bot sends a broadcast message.
        Parameters:
        botNum - The ID of the Bot who sent the message, or BattleBotArena.SYSTEM_MSG if the message is from the referee.
        msg - The text of the message that was broadcast.

      • imageNames

        public abstract java.lang.String[] imageNames()
        This is called by the arena at startup to find out what image names you want it to load for you. All images must be stored in the images folder of the project, but you only have to return their names (not their paths).

        PLEASE resize your images in an image manipulation program. They should be squares of size RADIUS * 2 so that they don't take up much memory.
        Returns:
        An array of image names you want the arena to load.

      • loadedImages

        public abstract void loadedImages(java.awt.Image[] images)
        Once the arena has loaded your images (see imageNames()), it calls this method to pass you the images it has loaded for you. Store them and use them in your draw method.

        PLEASE resize your images in an image manipulation program. They should be squares of size RADIUS * 2 so that they don't take up much memory.

        CAREFUL: If you got the file names wrong, the image array might be null or contain null elements.
        Parameters:
        images - The array of images (or null if there was a problem)

      • assignNumber

        public void assignNumber(int botNum)
        Called by the arena to assign your unique id number at the start of each round. There is probably no need to override this method.
        Parameters:
        botNum - Your ID number

      • run

        public final void run()
        Stops Bot developers from cheating by spawning a Thread. The human referee should also check to make sure they are only using a single class and no inner classes (check to make sure there is only one .class file per Bot).

      • actionPerformed

        public final void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Stops Bot developers from cheating by using a Timer. The human referee should also check to make sure they are only using a single class and no inner classes (check to make sure there is only one .class file per Bot).
